author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**svantemand**
Any news on multi-client testnets? This guy seems to think there's one running: https://www.reddit.com/r/ethereum/comments/e9moc2/current_state_of_eth_20/fajt2a5

author: mratsim
content: There is a Prysm+ Parity, and then single client testnets

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**cem_ozer**
when doing the beaconBlocksByRange request, do any clients have a limit on how many blocks the requester can ask?

author: prestonvanloon
content: Not set on that value though, just put something to have something

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**cem_ozer**
seems like there is consensus that there will be a limit regardless of the constant

author: protolambda
content: <@!144468805697929216> hey, nice article about staking and deposits (https://www.attestant.io/posts/understanding-ethereum-staking-deposits/). I noticed that the pubkey used for withdrawal credentials is not explicitly a different pubkey, so to get security fully right (I imagine people will look back at articles like these as reference like!), can you please make it explicit that you should use a different key than the regular pubkey used everywhere else? See deposit contract spec: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/master/specs/core/0_deposit-contract.md#withdrawal-credentials Thanks!

author: jgm
content: Yeah I tried to show this with the keys having different values and coming from different places but I'll add a note that makes it explicit.  Thanks for the suggestion.
